intro: Atylosia latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal atylosia, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Atylosia latisepala is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
